listing.letting_fees:
Please note the charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on your circumstances and the number of tenants.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £300 is made for the preparation of the original Agreement and a further £125 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into.

Should you change tenants at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300.


Security deposit


A security deposit is required equating to at least 1 and a half month's rent. This deposit is held by us or passed to your landlord.


Tenancy deposit protection


Your security deposit must be protected by your agent or the landlord via a government approved tenancy deposit scheme. This is to ensure that if disputes arise these will be resolved by an independent third party. Within 30 days of paying your deposit your landlord or agent is required to give you details of the scheme.


Initial monies


The Initial Money consists of:

  • First month's rent in advance


  • Security Deposit


  • Administration Fee £50 per tenant


  • Referencing Fee £75 per tenant


  • Check-in fee - minimum of £72.00 (There may be instances where applicants pay for check-outs instead. Contact your local branch for more information)


  • Tenancy Agreement £300 (if supplied by us)


If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:

  • Guarantor Referencing Fee £100 per guarantor


  • Agreement of Guarantee £75


And if the tenant is a company:

  • Company Referencing Fee £175


Other Charges:

  • Change of Sharer £300


  • Extension Agreements £125


  • Outgoing reference fee £24


Optional extras if agreed:

  • Saturday Move-In £60


The Initial Money will be confirmed and must be paid by debit card, bankers draft or building society cheque. If you use a credit card there will be a 3% additional fee.

We do not accept cash.

Rental payments

All rent is payable in advance by standing order. All payments should be made 72hrs prior to your rent due date to allow for clearance. Any financial problems you may encounter should reported to us.

What fees can I expect to pay if I rent a property with Your Move?

When you have agreed on the property of your choice, Your Move will provide you with a Tenancy Fee Declaration. This helps explain not only the next stages of your application but any fee which is due before you sign your Tenancy Agreement and any fees which may become payable during and after the tenancy. This will also include confirmation of the agreed rent and the security deposit.

Below is a list of our current fee scales. At any time you are interested in a property, please ask a member of staff for a full breakdown of fees that may be payable before, during and after a tenancy.

Tenancy set up £342 inc. VAT

listing.description: **no administration fees**contemporary three bedroom terraced house in A sought after development...Location, location, location…We are pleased to present this early 2000’s built, three bedroom, terraced house set in a quiet cul-de-sac only a stones throw away from Bromley South Mainline station. Being only a five minute walk from Bromley South and the wonderful array of shops, restaurants and shopping centre’s Bromley has to offer this property is ideal for the families and everyday commuters.This delightful home has been decorated to a modern, neutral standard throughout expressing the homely feel from top to bottom.Upon entering the property you are welcomed by a practical, pine wood, fully integrated kitchen to the left whilst the large, substantial reception room with featured fireplace lays straight ahead. The reception room is bright and airy allowing natural light to beam through and flood the room.Directly accessible from the reception room you are greeted by a well looked after, landscaped garden with outhouse available for full use to satisfy your storage needs. Also on the ground floor of this well proportioned, deluxe family home you will find a WC and ample storage space, including a very large under stairs cupboard.The first floor of this property you will find the master bedroom which is of an excellent size. The bedroom also offers an en-suite shower room which consist of a three piece suite. The second bedroom is also a good size double room and allows plenty of space for your much needed bedroom furniture. The third bedroom can be used as an office, dressing room or large single bedroom.The family bathroom has been refurbished to a very high, modern standard. With a newly installed three piece suite and luxurious marble tiles you’ll be itching to relax whilst having a long, well deserved soak in the bath after a long hard days work.There are also two allocated parking spaces included with the property.Additional benefits include double glazed throughout and gas central heating.Available now! So call to register your interest now!General information:Bromley is a large suburban district of south east London, [1] England, and the administrative headquarters of the London Borough of Bromley. It was historically a market town, and prior to 1965 was in the county of Kent and formed the administrative centre of the Municipal Borough of Bromley. Its location on a coaching route and the opening of a railway station in 1858 were key to its development and the economic history of Bromley is underpinned by a shift from an agrarian village to commercial and retail hub. As part of the suburban growth of London in the 20th century, Bromley significantly increased in population and has formed part of Greater London since 1965. It has developed into one of a handful of regionally significant commercial and retail districts outside central London.[2] It is located 9.3 miles (15 km) south east of Charing Cross and is one of the major metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan.

listing.letting_fees:
Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.

listing.description: Spacious two double bedroom, two bathroom apartment to rent within half A mile of bromley south...Within a five minute approx. Walk to Bromley South mainline station, offering excellent commuter trains is this sumptuous two double bedroom London style apartment. In one of Bromley’s most exclusive blocks, with an allocated parking space this second floor flat is serviced by an upscale lift. The welcoming hallway sets off the tone of the flat with magnificent wooden floors and classic cream walls. Natural light floods into the dual aspect l-shape lounge through two large Juliette balconies. The divine lounge encompasses enough space to create the illusion of two separate living spaces, one to house a dining table and chairs for entertaining, and the other a seating area. The Juliette balconies offer views over Bromley turning this living room into a vibrantly engaging space. The stylish kitchen is fitted with sleek modern appliances and is entered via an archway from the lounge. A perfect contemporary cooking space filled with warm natural sunlight from the Juliette balconies adjacent. The property has two substantial double bedrooms both with fitted mirror door wardrobes. The master bedroom has attached a fresh en-suite shower room, with fittings in shiny chrome adding a contemporary touch. A pristine pure white tiled second bathroom offers a bath tub with shower over bath and cleverly incorporates a heated towel rail. Available end of March. View now!General information:Bromley is a large suburban district of south east London, [1] England, and the administrative headquarters of the London Borough of Bromley. It was historically a market town, and prior to 1965 was in the county of Kent and formed the administrative centre of the Municipal Borough of Bromley. Its location on a coaching route and the opening of a railway station in 1858 were key to its development and the economic history of Bromley is underpinned by a shift from an agrarian village to commercial and retail hub. As part of the suburban growth of London in the 20th century, Bromley significantly increased in population and has formed part of Greater London since 1965. It has developed into one of a handful of regionally significant commercial and retail districts outside central London.[2] It is located 9.3 miles (15 km) south east of Charing Cross and is one of the major metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan.

Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.

listing.letting_fees:
Referencing fee payable per occupant over 18 years old.

England and Wales - £118.80 inc. VAT.

London - £150 inc. VAT.

Students - £72 inc. VAT.

Includes the full cost of referencing all of the tenants that will form part of the tenancy and will cover:

- Checking credit status;

- Previous employer;

- Current or past landlords; and

- Any other information to help assess the affordability of the application.

Company lets will be subject to an administration fee charge of £90 inc. VAT.

Inventory fee (England, Wales and London only)

Some landlords ask Purplebricks to employ an external inventory company to produce an inventory for their property before the move in. Where this applies, the cost is split between the landlord and tenant.

Inventory documentation will detail the fixtures, fittings and condition of a property prior to the commencement of a tenancy; this will subsequently provide the basis for settlement in a deposit dispute. If an inventory is inadequate or non-existent then a deposit adjudicator is likely to award the deposit to the outgoing tenant, leaving a landlord out of pocket for any dirt or damage that is left behind.

Purplebricks can arrange for an inventory to be compiled at a cost to the tenant of £90 inc. VAT for 1 to 3 bed properties and £120 inc. VAT for 4+ bed properties. Please note that London properties will be subject to a variation on these prices, £120 inc. VAT for 1-3 bedrooms and £150 inc. VAT for 4+ bedrooms.

Scotland

Prospective tenants of properties in Scotland are not required to pay any of the fees detailed above.

Northern Ireland

Prospective tenants of properties in Northern Ireland will be asked to pay £48 inc. VAT referencing fees per person. No inventory fees will be payable.

Please note the charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on your circumstances and the number of tenants.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £300 is made for the preparation of the original Agreement and a further £125 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into.

Should you change tenants at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300.


Security deposit


A security deposit is required equating to at least 1 and a half month's rent. This deposit is held by us or passed to your landlord.


Tenancy deposit protection


Your security deposit must be protected by your agent or the landlord via a government approved tenancy deposit scheme. This is to ensure that if disputes arise these will be resolved by an independent third party. Within 30 days of paying your deposit your landlord or agent is required to give you details of the scheme.


Initial monies


The Initial Money consists of:

  • First month's rent in advance


  • Security Deposit


  • Administration Fee £50 per tenant


  • Referencing Fee £75 per tenant


  • Check-in fee - minimum of £72.00 (There may be instances where applicants pay for check-outs instead. Contact your local branch for more information)


  • Tenancy Agreement £300 (if supplied by us)


If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:

  • Guarantor Referencing Fee £100 per guarantor


  • Agreement of Guarantee £75


And if the tenant is a company:

  • Company Referencing Fee £175


Other Charges:

  • Change of Sharer £300


  • Extension Agreements £125


  • Outgoing reference fee £24


Optional extras if agreed:

  • Saturday Move-In £60


The Initial Money will be confirmed and must be paid by debit card, bankers draft or building society cheque. If you use a credit card there will be a 3% additional fee.

We do not accept cash.

Rental payments

All rent is payable in advance by standing order. All payments should be made 72hrs prior to your rent due date to allow for clearance. Any financial problems you may encounter should reported to us.
listing.description: Two double bedroom apartment with private courtyard not far from bromley south..With wonderful cafes, restaurants, excellent private gyms and brilliant commuter links nearby; is this remarkably spacious 2 double bedroom apartment with private courtyard garden. On the raised ground floor of this impressive block, the large welcoming entrance hall leads to a fantastic lounge with plenty of room to comfortably house a dining table, and full length doors that can be opened up to your patio area. The kitchen is fitted with a range of classic units and modern appliances, and the bathroom features a neutral suite. Both bedrooms are of good sizes and the second bedroom offers patio doors to a balcony providing yet more outside space. Behind security gates you are allocated a parking space while your guests benefit from plenty of visitor bays. There is high demand for this type of property and we urge you to register your interest now. Available end of September. Offered furnished or unfurnished. View now!General information:Bromley is a large suburban district of south east London, [1] England, and the administrative headquarters of the London Borough of Bromley. It was historically a market town, and prior to 1965 was in the county of Kent and formed the administrative centre of the Municipal Borough of Bromley. Its location on a coaching route and the opening of a railway station in 1858 were key to its development and the economic history of Bromley is underpinned by a shift from an agrarian village to commercial and retail hub. As part of the suburban growth of London in the 20th century, Bromley significantly increased in population and has formed part of Greater London since 1965. It has developed into one of a handful of regionally significant commercial and retail districts outside central London.[2] It is located 9.3 miles (15 km) south east of Charing Cross and is one of the major metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan.

It was historically a market town, and prior to 1965 was in the county of Kent and formed the administrative centre of the Municipal Borough of Bromley. Please note the charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on your circumstances and the number of tenants.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £300 is made for the preparation of the original Agreement and a further £125 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into.

Should you change tenants at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300.


Security deposit


A security deposit is required equating to at least 1 and a half month's rent. This deposit is held by us or passed to your landlord.


Tenancy deposit protection


Your security deposit must be protected by your agent or the landlord via a government approved tenancy deposit scheme. This is to ensure that if disputes arise these will be resolved by an independent third party. Within 30 days of paying your deposit your landlord or agent is required to give you details of the scheme.


Initial monies


The Initial Money consists of:

  • First month's rent in advance


  • Security Deposit


  • Administration Fee £50 per tenant


  • Referencing Fee £75 per tenant


  • Check-in fee - minimum of £72.00 (There may be instances where applicants pay for check-outs instead. Contact your local branch for more information)


  • Tenancy Agreement £300 (if supplied by us)


If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:

  • Guarantor Referencing Fee £100 per guarantor


  • Agreement of Guarantee £75


And if the tenant is a company:

  • Company Referencing Fee £175


Other Charges:

  • Change of Sharer £300


  • Extension Agreements £125


  • Outgoing reference fee £24


Optional extras if agreed:

  • Saturday Move-In £60


The Initial Money will be confirmed and must be paid by debit card, bankers draft or building society cheque. If you use a credit card there will be a 3% additional fee.

We do not accept cash.

Rental payments

All rent is payable in advance by standing order. All payments should be made 72hrs prior to your rent due date to allow for clearance. Any financial problems you may encounter should reported to us.

listing.letting_fees:
Please note the charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on your circumstances and the number of tenants.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £300 is made for the preparation of the original Agreement and a further £125 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into.

Should you change tenants at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300.


Security deposit


A security deposit is required equating to at least 1 and a half month's rent. This deposit is held by us or passed to your landlord.


Tenancy deposit protection


Your security deposit must be protected by your agent or the landlord via a government approved tenancy deposit scheme. This is to ensure that if disputes arise these will be resolved by an independent third party. Within 30 days of paying your deposit your landlord or agent is required to give you details of the scheme.


Initial monies


The Initial Money consists of:

  • First month's rent in advance


  • Security Deposit


  • Administration Fee £50 per tenant


  • Referencing Fee £75 per tenant


  • Check-in fee - minimum of £72.00 (There may be instances where applicants pay for check-outs instead. Contact your local branch for more information)


  • Tenancy Agreement £300 (if supplied by us)


If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:

  • Guarantor Referencing Fee £100 per guarantor


  • Agreement of Guarantee £75


And if the tenant is a company:

  • Company Referencing Fee £175


Other Charges:

  • Change of Sharer £300


  • Extension Agreements £125


  • Outgoing reference fee £24


Optional extras if agreed:

  • Saturday Move-In £60


The Initial Money will be confirmed and must be paid by debit card, bankers draft or building society cheque. If you use a credit card there will be a 3% additional fee.

We do not accept cash.

Rental payments

All rent is payable in advance by standing order. All payments should be made 72hrs prior to your rent due date to allow for clearance. Any financial problems you may encounter should reported to us.
listing.description: Huge 1 double bedroom split maisonette, with private access to large balcony overlooking stunning communal grounds. Ideal for couples or single professionals, the property features a seperate bathroom and shower, white goods are included. Other benefits are bills will be include well maintained communal gardens with direct access from property and ample parking available. Available now!ShoppingBromley Town Centre has long been one of the south-east’s foremost shopping destinations. The town centre presents an appealing mixture of retail chains, independent and specialist shops, bars and restaurants- all crowned of course by the focal point of intu Bromley, an indoor shopping centre with over 120 shops. The central part of the High Street has been pedestrianised, which not only allows for greater freedom of movement for shoppers, but has also made a variety of markets and street entertainment possible, making the town centre a vibrant and thriving place to live, work an shop.EatingBromley is packed with places to eat to suit every taste and pocket. This array of pubs, cafes and restaurants is truly diverse, representing cuisines from all over the world, and is another facet of the cosmopolitan quality that distinguishes the town centre.Night lifeBromley is a great place to be and our vibrant nightlife makes the town hugely popular. As with Bromley town centre’s restaurant scene, there is a nightspot for every occasion from a relaxed drink in the pub to lively nightclubs in which to dance the night away.Arts & cultureThere are a number of opportunities to enjoy arts and culture in and around Bromley Town Centre. Whatever your interests are- from opera to international cinema- there are ample opportunities to get involved and get creative by attending clubs and courses in the local area. There are also a whole host of performances taking place throughout the year if you prefer to watch others display their talents, so you need never be at a loss for entertainment.HotelsBromley has a number of large hotels offering luxury accommodation, venues for business conferences and also picturesque wedding venues. With its close proximity to London, Bromley’s hotels are the perfect location for an overnight stay.Bromley means businessBromley is the largest borough occupying strategic position in the South East of the capital, with a mix of rural areas, leafy suburbs and urban centres.The Bromley Town Centre Area Action Plan (aap) is a comprehensive plan to guide development and improvements in Bromley’s town centre over the next 15 years.
